result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Christopher M. Kathamegos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher M. Kathamegos is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher M. Kathamegos was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Christopher M. Kathamegos was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No use of internet/computer access unless approved by PO. 

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol, however defendant allowed to enter Ginmill (family business) for purposes of employment.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.  

Deft to follow terms and conditions of his rules through Lincoln County case.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 12:02pm
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Def appears in person and with Atty Henry Schultz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State files Amended Information
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Attempted Mental Harm to Child)>> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 (Poss Para)>> NO CONTEST
Ct. 4 (DC)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty on Cts. 3 and 4 only.

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 3.5 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.
DEOJ RH>> 9/1/21 at 8:30am
Bond continues on Ct. 1

Cts. 3 and 4>> Sentence W/held on each count; 2 years Probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Def to follow terms and conditions of his rules through Lincoln County case; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; DNA surcharge; No use of internet/computer access unless approved by PO; CC; Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, however Defendant allowed to enter Ginmill (family business) for purposes of employment.

>>Defendant may transfer probation to Oneida County
